title: Lead Process Excellence- Supply Chain Management
tagsAndSkills: Process Optimization,Risk Assessment,Project Management,Process Mapping,Data Analysis,Supply Chain Management,Optimization,Data
jobDescription:
Role & Responsibilities:


  • Process Assessment: Conduct thorough assessments and evaluations of existing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, inefficiencies, and bottlenecks. Taking responsibility of periodical audit, inventory management, vendor payment and various IT process automation time to time. Doing analysis on risk on supply chain and making counter strategy on how to prevent and do the risk-free operations & process.
  • Data Collection and Analysis: Gather and analyze data related to process performance, utilizing statistical and analytical tools to identify trends and areas requiring attention.
  • Process Mapping: Create detailed process maps and flowcharts to visualize current processes and pinpoint areas for optimization.
  • Performance Metrics: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure process effectiveness and monitor progress in process improvement initiatives.
  • Continuous Improvement: Develop and implement process improvement strategies, methodologies, and best practices such as Lean Six Sigma or Total Quality Management (TQM).
  • Root Cause Analysis: Identify root causes of process issues and inefficiencies and recommend solutions to address these issues effectively.
  • Change Management: Collaborate with stakeholders to implement process changes and ensure successful adoption by employees.
  • Documentation & Project Management: Maintain accurate documentation of process improvements, changes, and associated procedures. Project Management: Lead or participate in cross-functional teams focused on process improvement projects, managing timelines, resources, and budgets.
  • Training and Education: Provide training and support to employees involved in the newly optimized processes, ensuring understanding and adherence to updated procedures.

title: Manager II - Mechanical Engineer
jobDescription:
• Carry out FEED, proposal (including work hour estimate) and detail engineering activities of Rotating equipment and packages (utilities /process plant packages, HVAC, Material handling equipment) discipline, such as preparation of design basis, technical requisitions, Vendor offer review and technical bid evaluations, vendor drawing review etc.
  • Shall be required to handle medium to large projects independently, as lead engineer; or as mentor of 2-3 projects.
  • Shall be responsible to ensure that the Quality Management system of the discipline is in place.
  • Shall participate in team development programmes and mentoring activities.
  • Shall be required to carry out group administration activities when required by Department Manager.
  • Shall be fully conversant with API, ASME and such codes of various rotating equipment and packages. Shall be proficient to carry out vendor discussions independently and communicate with Vendors independently.
  • Shall be able to co-ordinate and liase with Client / PMC and take part in discussions with Client / PMC.
  • Should have lead at least 2 - 3 large sized project (of more than 7500 work hours for MEG only) as lead engineer from start to finish (or at least for 80% of it).
  • Should have hands on experience in megawatt range and complex and critical rotating equipment and packages detail engineering activities.
  • Thorough understanding of interdepartmental relationships and requirements is must.
  • Should be well conversant in reading and interpreting P&ID, process descriptions etc Should have participated in reviews such as Model review, Hazop review etc.
  • Should have very good communication skills (verbal as well as written), presentation skills and leadership qualities. Should be good at team building.
  • Should have EPC project experience.
  • Should be able to mentor juniors, undertake development activities such as work instructions, checklists etc.
  • Should be able to handle departmental responsibilities when required by Department head.
  • Mechanical Engineering degree is a must. Any additional post graduate qualification or professional certification will be preferred.
  • Minimum 20 years experience in detail engineering consultancy is preferred. However, similar working experience in design side of OEM or mechanical / technical services department of a Refinery /
  • Petrochemical / Fertiliser / Chemical plant may also be considered.
  • However, last 10 to 14 years experience should be in detail engineering consultancy.
